risk_factors: Being 20 years old falls in a high-risk age group for criminal behavior
Males statistically show higher recidivism rates
Only one prior arrest with no convictions suggests limited criminal history
Lack of high school diploma/GED significantly limits employment opportunities
Having only one job in a year indicates employment instability
Not living alone but lacking stable independent housing can be a risk factor
No recent drug use is a positive protective factor
No reported depression is a positive indicator
Very large household size may indicate childhood instability/poverty
Religious beliefs have minimal direct correlation with recidivism

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 20-year-old male who identifies himself as Hispanic. He has been arrested 1 time but has not been convicted. He is 5 feet 10 inches and weighs 180 lbs. He has never been married and is currently not living alone. He does not have a high school diploma or GED certificate and is not enrolled in college. He has held 1 job during the year. He has not used any drugs in the past four years and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, he lived in a household of size 11. He considers that God has nothing to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
